docs.abstract: Jun Ying, a former top technology official at the consumer credit reporting agency, sold nearly $1 million in shares before the public was told of a major data breach, the S.E.C. said in a complaint.
docs.snippet: Jun Ying, a former top technology official at the consumer credit reporting agency, sold nearly $1 million in shares before the public was told of a major data breach, the S.E.C. said in a complaint.
docs.lead_paragraph: A former top Equifax executive was charged on Wednesday with insider trading for selling nearly $1 million in company stock after he learned about a major data breach in 2017 but before it was publicly announced.

headline.main: Ex-Equifax Executive Charged With Insider Trading Tied to ’17 Breach
headline.print_headline: Former Equifax Executive Charged With Insider Trading in 2017 Breach

docs.abstract: The deal would end a class-action suit by shareholders who claimed they were harmed by the bank’s false statements about a scandal over sham accounts.
docs.snippet: The deal would end a class-action suit by shareholders who claimed they were harmed by the bank’s false statements about a scandal over sham accounts.
docs.lead_paragraph: Wells Fargo’s tab for its sham accounts scandal shot up again on Friday, when the bank agreed to pay $480 million to settle a class-action claim from shareholders who said they were harmed by the bank’s false statements about its misdeeds.

headline.main: Wells Fargo Agrees to Settle With Shareholders for $480 Million
headline.print_headline: Wells Fargo Agrees to $480 Million Settlement Over Sham Accounts

docs.abstract: A lawsuit by a former employee claims that when customers complained of fraudulent activity in their accounts, the bank closed the accounts instead of investigating them.
docs.snippet: A lawsuit by a former employee claims that when customers complained of fraudulent activity in their accounts, the bank closed the accounts instead of investigating them.
docs.lead_paragraph: When signs of fraud appear on a customer’s account, such as a counterfeit check or an unauthorized withdrawal, a bank is required by law to investigate whether criminal activity has occurred. Wells Fargo had a simpler solution, according to a former employee: Close the account and drop the customer.

headline.main: Wells Fargo Accused of Harming Fraud Victims by Closing Accounts
headline.print_headline: Wells Fargo Is Accused Of Harming Fraud Victims

byline.original: By Emily Flitter and Stacy Cowley

docs.abstract: The Consumer Financial Protection Bureau’s acting director is paying operations costs from its reserves this quarter, his latest move to curb the agency.
docs.snippet: The Consumer Financial Protection Bureau’s acting director is paying operations costs from its reserves this quarter, his latest move to curb the agency.
docs.lead_paragraph: The Consumer Financial Protection Bureau’s acting director, Mick Mulvaney, intensified his efforts this week to curb an agency he has denounced as a regulator run amok. His latest tactic: starve it of cash.

headline.print_headline: Latest Budget Request For Consumer Bureau: $0

docs.abstract: The rocky tenure of the E.P.A. chief Scott Pruitt continues. The Associated Press reports that its correspondent was “shoved out of the building by a security guard.”
docs.snippet: The rocky tenure of the E.P.A. chief Scott Pruitt continues. The Associated Press reports that its correspondent was “shoved out of the building by a security guard.”
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — The Environmental Protection Agency on Tuesday barred reporters from three news organizations from an event on the impact of toxic chemicals on drinking water at the agency’s headquarters.

headline.main: Three Reporters Are Turned Away From an E.P.A. Event

byline.original: By Coral Davenport and Jaclyn Peiser

docs.abstract: The automaker said it wanted to reassess its testing program after an autonomous Uber vehicle killed a pedestrian.
docs.snippet: The automaker said it wanted to reassess its testing program after an autonomous Uber vehicle killed a pedestrian.
docs.lead_paragraph: The fatal accident involving an autonomous vehicle operated by the ride-hailing service Uber has prompted one automaker to temporarily halt its testing of self-driving cars on public roads.

headline.main: Toyota Takes Self-Driving Cars Off Road After Uber Accident
headline.print_headline: Toyota Halts Self-Driving Car Tests After Uber Accident

docs.abstract: The search for Nirav Modi captivates a country increasingly frustrated by corruption cases involving state banks that could cost taxpayers dearly.
docs.snippet: The search for Nirav Modi captivates a country increasingly frustrated by corruption cases involving state banks that could cost taxpayers dearly.
docs.lead_paragraph: NEW DELHI — Nirav Modi brightened Kate Winslet’s earlobes and made Taraji P. Henson’s collarbone glitter.

headline.main: Jeweler to the Stars Flees as India Seethes Over Bank Fraud
headline.print_headline: Jeweler to the Stars  Flees as India Seethes

docs.abstract: Missteps, confusion and a bureaucratic reshuffling on the Chinese side could lessen the already long odds that talks this week will soothe trade tensions between China and the United States.
docs.snippet: Missteps, confusion and a bureaucratic reshuffling on the Chinese side could lessen the already long odds that talks this week will soothe trade tensions between China and the United States.
docs.lead_paragraph: BEIJING — China is struggling to find people in Washington who can provide insight into the Trump administration’s aggressive moves on trade. One senior American trade insider tried to help — and wound up in Beijing with little to do but check out the pottery.

headline.main: As U.S. and Chinese Teams Meet on Trade, One Side Has an Edge in Expertise
headline.print_headline: China Faces Expertise Gap In Trade Talks With U.S.

docs.abstract: A series of looming deadlines will put pressure on U.S. partners to reach deals, in a high-risk strategy that may not solve deeper and more persistent problems.
docs.snippet: A series of looming deadlines will put pressure on U.S. partners to reach deals, in a high-risk strategy that may not solve deeper and more persistent problems.
docs.lead_paragraph: Trade pacts typically require years of detailed negotiations. The North American Free Trade Agreement needed two years. Creation of the World Trade Organization took eight.

headline.main: Trade Deals Take Years. Trump Wants to Remake Them in Months.
headline.print_headline: Armed With Tariffs, Trump Rushes to Remake Trade Deals That Took Years to Write

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Office of the United States Trade Representative

docs.abstract: Officials appear to be warming to the idea of imposing the country’s first national tax on homes to cool a market subject to wild booms and busts.
docs.snippet: Officials appear to be warming to the idea of imposing the country’s first national tax on homes to cool a market subject to wild booms and busts.
docs.lead_paragraph: NANJING, China — China has tried just about everything to tame a property market in which home prices sometimes jump around like the value of Bitcoin.

headline.main: China’s Housing Market Is Like a Casino. Can a Property Tax Tame It?
headline.print_headline: A Tax That Could Break China’s Fever
